subject: Music
title: Louis Armstrong Changes Everything
description: One-minute skill: Louis Armstrong Changes Everything.

hook.text: Louis Armstrong turned jazz from group music into a soloist's art form.

buildup.text: Growing up poor in New Orleans, he learned cornet in a juvenile home's brass band.

discovery.text: His Hot Five recordings in the 1920s introduced improvised solos as jazz's centerpiece.

twist.text: He also pioneered scat singing â€” using his voice as an instrument when words weren't enough.

climax.text: His gravelly voice and trumpet became the sound of jazz for the entire world.

punchline.text: Armstrong didn't play jazz. He became it.

quiz.question: What did Louis Armstrong introduce to jazz?
options: Improvised solos as the centerpiece and scat singing
